biog.entry.name: PLIBERSEK, the Hon. Tanya Joan
biog.entry.description: Biography for PLIBERSEK, the Hon. Tanya Joan
biog.entry.electorate.name: Member for Sydney (NSW)
biog.entry.title: Biography for PLIBERSEK, the Hon. Tanya Joan
biog.entry.electorate.state.name: Member for Sydney (NSW)
biog.entry.party.name: Australian Labor Party

parliamentary.service.title: Parliamentary Service
parliamentary.service.para: Elected to the House of Representatives for Sydney, New South Wales, 1998, 2001, 2004, 2007, 2010 and 2013.

ministerial.appointments.title: Ministerial Appointments
ministerial.appointments.para: Minister for the Status of Women from 3.12.07 to 14.9.10.
Minister for Human Services from 14.9.10 to 14.12.11.
Minister for Social Inclusion from 14.9.10 to 14.12.11.
Minister for Health and Medical Research from 1.7.13 to 18.9.13.

committee.service.title: Committee Service
committee.service.para: House of Representatives Standing: Economics, Finance and Public Administration from 31.8.00 to 8.10.01; Education and Training from 20.3.02 to 31.8.04; Privileges from 16.5.02 to 17.10.07.
Joint Statutory: Public Accounts and Audit from 8.12.98 to 10.4.00 and from 20.3.02 to 31.8.04; Intelligence and Security from 12.12.13 to 26.12.14.
Joint Standing: Foreign Affairs, Defence and Trade from 4.12.13.

conf.delegations.visits.title: Conferences, Delegations and Visits
conf.delegations.visits.para: Official visit to USA, February-March 2009; Solomon Islands, Nauru and Vanuatu, December 2013; Jordan, Lebanon and Israel, January 2014; France, Belgium and Indonesia, April 2014; China, June 2014.
Member, Parliamentary Delegation to the 22nd AIPO General Assembly, Bangkok, Thailand and bilateral visit to Singapore, September 2001.

parliamentary.party.positions.title: Parliamentary Party Positions
parliamentary.party.positions.para: Deputy Leader of the Federal Parliamentary Labor Party from 14.10.13.
Deputy Leader of the Opposition from 14.10.13.

Member, Opposition Shadow Ministry from 22.10.04 to 3.12.07 and from 14.10.13. Shadow Minister for Work and Family, Child Care and Youth and Shadow Minister for Women from 26.10.04 to 10.12.06; Shadow Minister for Community from 26.10.04 to 24.6.05; Shadow Minister for Human Services, Housing, Youth and Women from 10.12.06 to 3.12.07.
Shadow Minister for Foreign Affairs and International Development from 18.10.13.

party.positions.title: Party Positions
party.positions.para: Member, ALP Status of Women Committee (NSW) 1994-98.
Deputy Chair, ALP Caucus Committee on Living Standards and Economic Development.
Member, ALP Caucus Committee on Social Policy.

quals.work.pre.parliament.title: Qualifications and Occupation before entering Federal Parliament
quals.work.pre.parliament.para: Master of Politics and Public Policy (Macquarie).
Women's Officer, University of Technology, Sydney.
Domestic Violence Unit, NSW Ministry for the Status of Women.

electorate.title: Electorate
electorate.para: Location: City of Sydney and inner western suburbs; it includes the suburbs of Alexandria, Balmain, Beaconsfield, Birchgrove, Broadway, Chippendale, Darlington, Erskineville, Forest Lodge, Glebe, Haymarket, Millers Point, Pyrmont, Redfern, Surry Hills, The Rocks, Ultimo, Waterloo, Zetland and parts of Annandale, Camperdown, Darlinghurst, Macdonaldtown, Newtown and Rozelle. It also includes Lord Howe Island and the harbour islands from Spectacle Island to the Heads.
Industries: commercial, financial, retail, merchandising, service, transport, entertainment and shipping industries.
State electorates: Sydney includes parts of the New South Wales Legislative Assembly electorates of Balmain, Heffron, Newtown, Port Macquarie (Lord Howe Island) and Sydney.
